medical_history.chief_complaint: Painless proptosis and edema of the right upper lid occurring over 2 months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 months prior to presentation. Initially painless proptosis and edema. Condition progressed with the development of a palpable nodule at the medial canthus representing a recurrence 2 months after initial surgery, followed by a second recurrence manifesting as ptosis 2 months after the second surgery. Subsequent follow-ups revealed further relapses.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous surgeries for recurrence of myxoid liposarcoma. Genetic testing confirmed the presence of Li-Fraumeni syndrome.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of malignancy; one sister with abdominal rhabdomyosarcoma and another with a maxillofacial sarcoma.
